trans-unit.source: Specifies whether view state will be enabled for a control.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to enable view state for an individual control even if it is disabled for the page.

To turn off view state for a page and turn it on for a specific control on the page, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.EnableViewState%2A> property of the page and the control to `true`, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateMode%2A> property of the page to Disabled, and set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateMode%2A> property of the control to Enabled.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateMode%2A> property of a page or a control has an effect only if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.EnableViewState%2A> property is set to `true`.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.EnableViewState%2A> property is set to `false`, view state will be turned off even if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateMode%2A> property is set to Enabled.
Disable view state for this control even if the parent control has view state enabled.
Enable view state for this control even if the parent control has view state disabled.
Inherit the value of <xref href="System.Web.UI.ViewStateMode"></xref> from the parent <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref>.
